attributes.action: Former Archbishop of York, John Sentamu, should be given a life peerage.
attributes.additional_details: While there is no automatic right for archbishops to be given a life peerage, his predecessor David Hope and the former archbishops of Canterbury Rowan Williams and George Carey were all made life peers when they stepped down.
attributes.background: To give a life peerage to John Sentamu the former Archbishop of York.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for people to be an honour such as a peerage.

You can find out how to nominate someone for non-political membership of the House of Lords here: https://lordsappointments.independent.gov.uk/how-to-apply.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.
